20101230171136.000|20101230171139.000|TR0|the sisters, arguing the time didn't fit 
20101230171139.000|20101230171141.000|TR0|the crime.  But here's the thing.  Freedom 
20101230171141.000|20101230171144.000|TR0|comes with a condition.  One sister must 
20101230171144.000|20101230171146.000|TR0|donate a kidney to the other.  That saves 
20101230171146.000|20101230171149.000|TR0|the state on dialysis costs.

20101230173440.000|20101230173443.000|TR0|
20101230173443.000|20101230173445.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101230173445.000|20101230173448.000|TR0|
20101230173448.000|20101230173450.000|TR0|JOHN ZARRELLA, CNN CORRESPONDENT (on 
20101230173450.000|20101230173453.000|TR0|camera): For more than 50 years, the 
20101230173453.000|20101230173455.000|TR0|Kennedy Space  Center has been the focal 
20101230173455.000|20101230173458.000|TR0|point of America's space program.  The 
20101230173458.000|20101230173500.000|TR0|vehicle assembly building over there where 
20101230173500.000|20101230173503.000|TR0|the Apollo moon rockets were assembled, 
20101230173503.000|20101230173505.000|TR0|space shuttles for the last 30 years 
20101230173505.000|20101230173508.000|TR0|assembled there.
20101230173508.000|20101230173511.000|TR0|
20101230173511.000|20101230173513.000|TR0|But now as the space shuttle program winds 
20101230173513.000|20101230173516.000|TR0|down, activity here at the Kennedy Space 
20101230173516.000|20101230173518.000|TR0|Center is winding down as well.  Next 
20101230173518.000|20101230173521.000|TR0|year, two shuttle flights are on the 
20101230173521.000|20101230173523.000|TR0|books.  One in February, one, perhaps, in 
20101230173523.000|20101230173526.000|TR0|April, and then NASA wants to add a third 
20101230173526.000|20101230173528.000|TR0|sometime around June or July next year.  
20101230173528.000|20101230173531.000|TR0|And that would be it.  That will be the 
20101230173531.000|20101230173533.000|TR0|end of the shuttle program.
20101230173533.000|20101230173536.000|TR0|
20101230173536.000|20101230173539.000|TR0|After that, commercial companies will 
20101230173539.000|20101230173541.000|TR0|start to pick up the slack. The plan is 
20101230173541.000|20101230173544.000|TR0|that by 2015, commercial companies will be 
20101230173544.000|20101230173546.000|TR0|flying U.S. astronauts to the 
20101230173546.000|20101230173549.000|TR0|international space station.  Until then, 
20101230173549.000|20101230173551.000|TR0|the United States is going to have to rely 
20101230173551.000|20101230173554.000|TR0|on the Russians to get its astronauts to 
20101230173554.000|20101230173556.000|TR0|the space station.
20101230173556.000|20101230173559.000|TR0|
